com.link_intersystems.lang

Class ContextAware<C>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.link_intersystems.lang.ContextAware<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C -
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClassLoaderContextAware

    public abstract class ContextAware<C>
extends Object
    Base class for handling of Runnable, Callable and method invocation to be executed within a specific context. The concrete context is defined by subclasses. The ContextAware only provides the template method that ensures that the concrete context is activated by calling activateContext() before a Runnable, Callable or method invocation is done and that the context gets de-activated after the call (even in case of an exception). Also support for creating java proxies that ensure that each call to the proxied interface(s) is context aware.

    Runnable context aware example

     Client                     ContextAware                   toRun:Runnable

  +-----------------------> runInContext(toRun)
  |                          |
  |                          +------+
  |                          |      |
  |                          |<-----+ activateContext()
  |                          |
  |                          +---------------------------> run()
  |                          |                              |
  |                          |<-----------------------------+
  |                          |
  |                          +------+
  |                          |      |
  |                          |<-----+ deactivateContext()
  |                          |
  |<-------------------------+

    Proxy context aware example

     Client                     ContextAware                                  proxy:ContextAwareProxy               someInstance:SomeInterface
  +-----------------------> createContextProxy(someInstance)
  |                          |
  |                          +-------------------------------------------> new
  |                          |
  |<--- proxy ---------------+
  |
  +---------------------------------------------------------------------> someMethod()
  |                                                                        |
  |                         runInContext(method...) <----------------------+
  |                          |
  |                          +------+
  |                          |      |
  |                          |<-----+ activateContext()
  |                          |
  |                          +--------------------------------------------------------------------------> someMethod()
  |                          |                                                                             |
  |                          |<----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
  |                          |
  |                          +------+
  |                          |      |
  |                          |<-----+ deactivateContext()
  |                          |
  |                          +-------------------------------------------->+
  |                                                                        |
  +<-----------------------------------------------------------------------+

    If a context is managed by a third library class that uses a callback method itself, e.g. TransactionManager.callInTransaction(TransactionCallback) the ContextAware.ContextProvider type can be used as CONTEXT_TYPE. The ContextAware.ContextProvider let you implement the adaption of a third party library class easily. If activateContext() returns an object of instance ContextAware.ContextProvider the context creation is delegated to ContextProvider#provideContext(RunInContext) and the ContextProvider#provideContext(RunInContext) must call ContextAware.RunInContext.proceed() to proceed with the Runnable or Callable that should be run in the context, e.g. runInContext(Callable) or runInContext(Runnable). 

     public class TransactionContextAware extends ContextAware<ContextProvider>(){

      private TransactionManagerCallbackAdapter tmca;

      public TransactionContextAware(TransactionManager tm){
           this.tmca = new TransactionManagerCallbackAdapter(tm);
      }

      protected ContextProvider activateContext(){
           return tmca;
      }

      protected void deactivateContext(ContextProvider contextProvider){
      }

      private static class TransactionManagerCallbackAdapter implements ContextProvider {

           public void provideContext(RunInContext runInContext) throws Exception {
                TransactionCallback tc = new TransactionCallbackAdapter(runInContext);
                tm.callInTransaction(tc);
           }

      }

      private static class TransactionCallbackAdapter implements TransactionCallback {

           private RunInContext ric;

           public TransactionCallbackAdapter(RunInContext ric){
                this.ric = ric;
           }

           public void doInTransaction(){
                  ric.proceed();
           }

      }

 }

 TransactionManager tm = ...;
 TransactionContextAware transactionContextAware = new TransactionContextAware(tm);

 Callable<Object> callable = ...;

 transactionContextAware.runInContext(callable); // ensures that the callable is run within a transaction
    Since:
    1.2.0;
    Author:
    René Link [rene.link@link- intersystems.com]

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ContextAware.ContextProvider
      A ContextAware.ContextProvider can be used as a ContextAware's CONTEXT_TYPE to let the ContextAware.ContextProvider implementation control the context creation.
      static interface  ContextAware.RunInContext
      Represents the object that should be run within a context.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract C activateContext()
      Subclasses must override this method to implement the activation of the context that they handle.
      void addContextListener(ContextListener<C> contextListener)
      Adds the ContextListener to this ContextAware.
      <T> T createContextProxy(T targetObject)
      Creates a java proxy that executes every call to the target object within the context that this ContextAware defines (defined by subclasses).
      protected abstract void deactivateContext(C context)
      Subclasses must override this method to implement the de-activation of the context they handle.
      protected void deactivateContext(C context, Exception exception)
      Subclasses might override this method to implement the de-activation of the context they handle in case of an exception.
      protected void fireContextActivated(C contextObject) 
      protected void fireContextDeactivated(C contextObject) 
      protected void fireContextDeactivated(C contextObject, Exception exception) 
      Method2 getInvocationMethod()
      The method of the context proxy that is invoked in case that getInvocationMethod() is called within a proxy call to a proxy that was created with createContextProxy(Object) otherwise null.
      <T> T invokeInContext(Object target, String method, Object... params)
      Same semantic as runInContext(Callable), but uses Class2.getApplicableMethod(String, Object...) to determine the method that should be invoked.
      <T> T invokeStaticInContext(Class<?> target, String method, Object... params)
      Same semantic as invokeInContext(Object, String, Object...), but searches for a static applicable method to invoke.
      void removeContextListener(ContextListener<C> contextListener)
      Removes the ContextListener from this ContextAware.
      <R> R runInContext(Callable<R> callable)
      Calls the Callable.call() method within this ContextAware 's context (defined by subclasses).
      void runInContext(Runnable runnable)
      Runs the Runnable in this ContextAware's context (defined by subclasses).

      • ContextAware

        public ContextAware()

    • Method Detail

      • getInvocationMethod

        public Method2 getInvocationMethod()
        The method of the context proxy that is invoked in case that getInvocationMethod() is called within a proxy call to a proxy that was created with createContextProxy(Object) otherwise null. If getInvocationMethod() is invoked by Runnable or Callable implementations that were passed to runInContext(Runnable) or runInContext(Callable) the getInvocationMethod() always returns null.
        Returns:
        the method of the context proxy that is invoked.
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • createContextProxy

        public <T> T createContextProxy(T targetObject)
        Creates a java proxy that executes every call to the target object within the context that this ContextAware defines (defined by subclasses).
        Parameters:
        targetObject - the target object to create a proxy for.
        Returns:
        a java proxy that executes every call to the target object's interfaces in this ClassLoaderContextAware.

      • runInContext

        public void runInContext(Runnable runnable)
        Runs the Runnable in this ContextAware's context (defined by subclasses).
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable that should be run with this ContextAware 's context (defined by subclasses).
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • runInContext

        public <R> R runInContext(Callable<R> callable)
                   throws Exception
        Calls the Callable.call() method within this ContextAware 's context (defined by subclasses).
        Parameters:
        callable - the Callable that should be called within this ContextAware's context (defined by subclasses).
        Returns:
        the result of the Callable.call() method.
        Throws:
        Exception - the exception that is thrown by the Callable.call() method.
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • addContextListener

        public void addContextListener(ContextListener<C> contextListener)
        Adds the ContextListener to this ContextAware.
        Since:

        public void removeContextListener(ContextListener<C> contextListener)
        Removes the ContextListener from this ContextAware.
        Since:

      • activateContext

        protected abstract C activateContext()
        Subclasses must override this method to implement the activation of the context that they handle.
        Returns:
        a context object that will be passed to the deactivateContext(Object) method on de-activation.
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • deactivateContext

        protected abstract void deactivateContext(C context)
        Subclasses must override this method to implement the de-activation of the context they handle.
        Parameters:
        context - the object that was returned by the activateContext() call.
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • deactivateContext

        protected void deactivateContext(C context,
                                 Exception exception)
        Subclasses might override this method to implement the de-activation of the context they handle in case of an exception. This default implementation just delegates to the deactivateContext(Object) method. When an Exception occurs the deactivateContext(Object, Exception) method is invoked first and after that ContextListeners get notified. At the end the exception is thrown further.
        Parameters:
        context - the object that was returned by the activateContext() call.
        exception - the exception that occurred while executing within the context.
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • invokeInContext

        public <T> T invokeInContext(Object target,
                             String method,
                             Object... params)
                      throws Exception
        Same semantic as runInContext(Callable), but uses Class2.getApplicableMethod(String, Object...) to determine the method that should be invoked.
        Parameters:
        target -
        method -
        params -
        Returns:
        the invoked method's return value
        Throws:
        Exception - if the invoked method throws an exception.
        Since:
        1.2.0;

      • invokeStaticInContext

        public <T> T invokeStaticInContext(Class<?> target,
                                   String method,
                                   Object... params)
                            throws Exception
        Same semantic as invokeInContext(Object, String, Object...), but searches for a static applicable method to invoke.
        Parameters:
        target - the Class that holds the static method.
        method - the method name of the static method that should be invoked.
        params - the invokation parameters.
        Returns:
        the invoked method's return value
        Throws:
        Exception - if the invoked method throws an exception.
        Since:
        1.2.0;
